intro: Adenocalymma pleiadenium, commonly known as the yellow bell heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender stems and small, leathery leaves that help it conserve water. Adenocalymma pleiadenium is often found in sandy or rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
